properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 10 at 6:16PM CST until January 10 at 6:45PM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
At 614 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located near Pantego, or near Richland Hills, moving northeast
at 35 mph. At 613 PM CST, spotters reported a funnel cloud close to
the 287 and 820 split near Forest Hill.

HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Weather spotters reported a funnel cloud.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage
to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree damage is
likely.

This dangerous storm will be near...
Richland Hills around 625 PM CST.
Arlington, Bedford and Hurst around 630 PM CST.
Fort Worth, Grand Prairie, Euless, Colleyville and North Richland
Hills around 635 PM CST.
DFW Airport around 640 PM CST.
Irving, Flower Mound, Grapevine, Coppell and Southlake around 645
PM CST.

Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include
Westlake.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a
vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter now!  Get to an
interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building and avoid
windows.

NWSheadline: A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CST FOR EASTERN TARRANT AND NORTHWESTERN DALLAS COUNTIES
